name: OF Doc Sprint @ DU
tagline: Documentation and information about the openFrameworks Education Summit hosted by Emergent Digital Practices at the University of Denver in February 2016
body:
![](images/header.png)

# openFrameworks Education Summit 2016
The openFrameworks Education Summit brings together Artists & Educators from the University of Denver, Carnegie Mellon University, The School of the Art Institute of Chicago, The School for Poetic Computation, Parsons School of Design, Penn State, The School for the Visual Arts, Microsoft, Carnegie Museum of Art, and internationally from  Vienna Austria, and Dresden Germany. Over the four days the participants will work together to produce and improve the educational materials for the open-source creative coding tool openFrameworks. This will improve the approachability of openFrameworks as well as help students around the world learn how to create with this powerful digital arts and design tool. 

### Participants
*[Golan Levin](http://flong.com/)
*Anika Wilcox
*[Nicole Messier](http://www.nicoleyimessier.com/)
*[Stacey Mulcahy](http://thebitchwhocodes.com/)

*[Deborah Schmidt](http://frauzufall.de/)
*[Charlotte Stiles](http://charlottestiles.com/)
*[David Newbury](http://www.workergnome.com/)
*[Caroline Record](http://carolinerecord.com/)
*[Dan Wilcox](http://www.danomatika.com/)
*[Jeff Gray](http://grayfuse.com/)
*[Andrew Hieronymi](http://ahieronymi.net/)
*[Caitlin Morris](http://www.caitlinmorris.net/)

*[Zach Lieberman](http://thesystemis.com/)
*[Brannon Dorsey](http://brannondorsey.com/)
*[Chris Coleman](http://digitalcoleman.com/)

### Support Provided By
Support Provided By:  [The Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences Division @ DU](http://www.du.edu/ahss/), [Emergent Digital Practices @ DU](http://www.du.edu/ahss/edp/), The Marsico Visiting Scholars Fund, [The Frank-Ratchye STUDIO for Creative Inquiry at Carnegie Mellon University](http://studioforcreativeinquiry.org/), [The School of the Art Institute of Chicago, Art and Technology Studies Department](http://www.saic.edu/academics/departments/ats/), [The School for Poetic Computation](http://sfpc.io/)
